function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of freedom of movement and face-to-face service provision","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fast spread of covid-19 leading to a global pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective collaborative practice in the malaysian mental health system","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High levels of heterogeneity in meta-analyses results","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor study quality in greenery","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Paucity of literature on the mechanisms underlying the relationship between greenspace and health","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Associations between greenspace and communicable diseases not considered","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to consider the impact of greenspace on mental health outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited inclusion of mental health and communicable disease outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of subgroup analysis by ses level in relation to greenspace exposure and health outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Missing criteria in quality appraisal of studies, specifically related to greenspace measurement and analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited research on the association between urban greenery and health benefits","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of replication of health benefits in an urban environment","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited guidance for national guidelines on urban greenery for health benefits","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Walking or running in a synthetic environment may convey fewer health benefits compared to a natural environment, potentially impacting public health.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of knowledge about the mechanisms underlying the relationship between greenspace and health may limit the ability to optimize health benefits from natural environments.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Undervaluation of greenspace as a resource for health may lead to underinvestment and underutilization of natural environments for promoting public health.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of subgroup analysis for ses groups in relation to greenspace and health outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Poor methodological quality and heterogeneity of outcome measures in previous systematic reviews","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent and mixed findings in relation to the association between greenspace and health outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inclusivity leading to high heterogeneity across studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Stronger associations between greenspace exposure and health outcomes for low socioeconomic status groups","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neighbourhood greenness decreasing the effect of income deprivation on mortality","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to greenspace may lead to health benefits","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to conduct meta-analyses for fasting blood glucose, cholesterol, hba1c, asthma, and triglycerides due to lack of high quality studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to conduct sensitivity analysis due to meta-analyses consisting only of studies scoring \\"    ,  "category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to conduct meta-analysis for certain health outcomes such as cancer, respiratory mortality, and neurological outcomes due to lack of comparable results from multiple studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Statistically nonsignificant results for certain health outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Substantial heterogeneity in study results","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inclusion of poor quality studies in the meta-analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Observational and interventional studies assessed using different checklists, which may lead to inconsistent assessment and comparison of results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Meta-analysis based on \\'high\\' and \\'low\\' greenspace exposure defined by individual papers\\u2019 highest and lowest categories, which may result in inconsistent categorization and interpretation of exposure on contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of valid and reliable tools for assessing participant outcomes related to green space exposure and contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Selection bias in the population","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inclusion bias in described","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"35 cohort studies and 69 cross-sectional studies, including 18 large scale ecological studies, may increase the risk of disease transmission due to the close contact and interactions among participants.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assessments of quality were initially made by one reviewer and then cross-checked by another, potentially leading to discrepancies in identifying risks of disease transmission in the study environments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Close interactions and discussions during the consensus process for quality assessments may pose a risk of disease transmission among the individuals involved.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exposure to urban or indoor environments without green
